website_summaries.verdict: The best value for those looking for a smaller option that fits in well with any décor.
pros: Comes in a variety of finishes
Narrow profile for fitting into small areas
cons: Many may find this too small, as you’ll only be able to fit 8-10 magazines in it

customer_reviews.title: Compact and yet just right.
customer_reviews.text: Bought these before. In searching found one more for my third bathroom. These are lovely. Small enough to be tidy; but also small enough to discourage me keeping the last couple of years of National Geographic at my toileting fingertips... And yet large enough to keep current issues at the ready should I want to settle in for an hour of potty time! <was that too much??? :-) >
customer_reviews.author: J. Nowlen

customer_reviews.title: Goodbye floor magazines!!
customer_reviews.text: Just what I wanted, a tidy and decorative wall mount magazine holder, so I could get rid of the old rack previously on the bathroom floor. Looks much cleaner, and I like that it only holds 8-10 magazines, so forces us to get rid of the old stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Nikki

customer_reviews.title: These baskets made the perfect mail holder for our kitchen
customer_reviews.text: These baskets made the perfect mail holder for our kitchen. I painted them red and they look great! I had a hard time looking for the perfect holder that would be sturdy enough to hold magazine and mail. These work wonderfully!
customer_reviews.author: Brittany M. Dreier

customer_reviews.title: Love how small the footprint is
customer_reviews.text: Holds more magazines than I expected (around 8-10, depending on the thickness). Love how small the footprint is. Mounted right next to the toilet with plenty of elbow room leftover. This replaced a traditional floor magazine rack and I'll never have one of those again. This would be perfect for office, mail sorter, dorm room, living room, and several other uses!
customer_reviews.author: Amber C.

customer_reviews.title: Looks nice, seems to be well constructed and holds coloring ...
customer_reviews.text: Looks nice, seems to be well constructed and holds coloring books/stickers and other art supplies for kids. INSTALL NOTE I would be sure to have a level to make sure that when you are attaching this to the wall you make sure that it is level. This comes with plastic drywall anchors for the screws which seems to be sufficient to hold thus far.
customer_reviews.author: DragonForest

customer_reviews.title: Great for holding hair dryer
customer_reviews.text: I have limited cabinet/counter space in my bathroom, so decided to utilize a caddy for my dryer and flat iron. This was easy to install, is sturdy, and puts my hair stuff in easy reach for the mornings. I'd purchase it again.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn G.

customer_reviews.title: Good deal
customer_reviews.text: I ordered 2 of the chrome ones. They are beside the toilets and now no more magazines on the floor. Makes for a nice clean bathroom. There's nothing really special about these holders except that you get a magazine rack that's nice enough for really little money. Hence the 5 stars. I'm pleased. Don't level by the screw holes as they were not level. Just place your torpedo level across the top or eyeball it.
customer_reviews.author: MP06011999

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Magazine Holder
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect size for our small bathroom. It looks great and has a nice finish to the metal. It was pretty easy to hang but it was a little difficult to get the drill in between the wire. Overall it took me about 5 minutes to drill and hang it. It looks great and holds a lot more than you would think!
customer_reviews.author: Casey M. Keathley

customer_reviews.title: Simple Elegance
customer_reviews.text: Simple, but looks perfect on my bathroom wall. Super easy to install (had no issues with the mounting kit included). I got the silver one and it looks pretty close to nickel so also matches fixtures etc pretty good. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: RDSWY4

customer_reviews.title: Great organizer for the restroom
customer_reviews.text: This has changed my life, really. Instead of having reading material cast about my bathroom, this fixed it. Solid construction and can hold quite a bit of reading material. It matches my bathroom fixtures to a T and cand hold the weight. This does mean that it must be mounted properly and by properly I mean good anchors. Anytime I purcahse something that mounts to the wall, I throw out the hardware and use my own.
customer_reviews.author: Abnfscoord

customer_reviews.title: Convenient out-of-the-way storage
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to replace a basket that was on the counter holding reading material in the bathroom. This attaches to a wall and will hold several Calvin and Hobbes cartoon books or numerous magazines. Keeps the counter tidy!
customer_reviews.author: MejiroBird

customer_reviews.title: Its okay.
customer_reviews.text: It figures that the standard screwdriver is JUST long enough to screw in the base to the wall. The screws it came with are crap though- if you are trying to screw it into wood (not drywall) the more you turn the screw, the more it strips. The grooves of the screws should be sturdier and deeper, just my opinion. Note: It only fits about 3-4 magazines of average size.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa C

customer_reviews.title: Keeps reading material off of the floor.
customer_reviews.text: Like this a lot. Installed it in the bathroom for the occasional perusal of magazine reading. I really like that it has made it easier to have reading material in the bathroom without seeing it on the floor.
customer_reviews.author: S. Olvera

customer_reviews.title: Only for standard-sized magazines
customer_reviews.text: I bought this rack because of many good reviews. The rack however is very small, only standard sized magazines (8.5" width) fit in there. A lot of magazines are however larger than the standard size and won't fit. You'll ask yourself why does it have so many good reviews when it doesn't fulfill a very basic task?
customer_reviews.author: bluewater3

customer_reviews.title: Grat Spacesaver & declutterer!
customer_reviews.text: I attached this magazine rack to my nightstand near my bed. Before, my magazines & books were cluttering my nightstand, or getting lost under my bed. Now, the books & magazines are at my fingertip, right near my bed. When I just received this, I was unsure if I would keep it or not, since it looked small, & I wasn't sure if this would fit what I needed. But after hanging & using this, I see it fits a lot more than it looks like it could. I fit both magazines, & a book in this.This was a well worth it purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Br A

customer_reviews.title: drilling and then using the hand screw driver to reach through the bars worked fine.
customer_reviews.text: This is somehow smaller than I thought it would be but it does the job. Just wanted a place to put magazines so they weren't on the counters. If you look at a magazine, this rack will cover the bottom half (maybe a little higher) and fit snuggly on each side. Installation was okay; you can't really use a drill unless you have bits long enough to reach the back screws through the front bars. Marking the holes, drilling and then using the hand screw driver to reach through the bars worked fine.
customer_reviews.author: AD

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for magazines
customer_reviews.text: This was perfect what I needed for wanted an entertainment area for the bathroom decided to include magazines so this was good for it holds steady looks stylish & gave it a spunk look .
customer_reviews.author: Xiomara

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: We recently built a library in the community clubhouse and needed something to place magazines in. I purchased three of these and they work great. They are stylish and of a great quality! I would definite recommend purchasing this product!
customer_reviews.author: RL

customer_reviews.title: Practical
customer_reviews.text: I actually mounted it on the side of a kitchen cabinet to hold all those instruction books etc. for appliances. Otherwise they get lost somewhere in a drawer...
customer_reviews.author: Hannelore R. Hampton

customer_reviews.title: Reading in the bathroom
customer_reviews.text: My bathroom is small, so there's no place to put reading material. I got this rack and stuck it on the wall above the toilet. it works, it's functional, and holds a few magazines and a book.
customer_reviews.author: Dr Word

customer_reviews.title: A good solution for holding magazines up off the ground
customer_reviews.text: Pretty neat little basket. It's not quite as big as I thought it would be. It's literally just about as wide as a magazine. Like it will hold your magazines, but there's no room to the right or left of them. So in essence, I guess that's a good thing. I don't really have anything negative to say about it. I use it in my master bathroom, and it's effective, and it does its job. But no, I wouldn't say I love it. It's just there. Thank you, InterDesign Classico Wall Mount Magazine Rack, for holding my favorite magazines.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Spacey

customer_reviews.title: It's the perfect pooper kit
customer_reviews.text: My husband always keeps multiple magazines in the bathroom, laying on the floor or on top of the sink and they were always getting wet. We attached these next to the toilet in each bathroom and now it's where the magazines live, YAY! We also put a package of wet wipes and potpurri spray in each one. It's the perfect pooper kit!
customer_reviews.author: saturn

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, well made and perfect for small areas!!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this magazine rack as a gift for my husband. He kept complaining that he could not find articles he had saved for reading. I read reviews describing how this rack is very small and yet can stand on its own. I decided after ordering it, to place it on his dresser next to his side of the bed. It has the wall for support and stands perfectly. This has turned out to be a solution to organizing his current reading materials and takes up little room. He likes the bronze color also. Thank you InterDesign and Amazon for helping to solve one of our marriage problems!!!
customer_reviews.author: Christine B.

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: This is a solid magazine holder. Very well made, classic and clean design, easy to wall mount. Feels strong and sturdy and fits a surprising number of magazines (the stack on the coffee table disappeared instantly when this arrived!) I like that it is neither cheap plastic nor dust-attracting wood and fits in so easily with any decor (I have no doubt it would look as good in a bathroom or kitchen as it does in my living room.) For the price, it's hard to match and I certainly looked before I decided- glad I went with this one!
customer_reviews.author: Rachel C

customer_reviews.title: Not easy to install on bathroom vanity
customer_reviews.text: Only includes drywall mount hardware. I wanted to mount this on the side of my vanity but the screws were too long. I didn't have any matching chrome screws, so I used the included ones anyway and hacksawed the ends off. Otherwise very nice, exactly what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: jimr

customer_reviews.title: Bsthroom boredome fighter.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install. Holds a variety of magazines. Guest bathroom is more entertaining. Put up another in the master bath so that I don't need my phone for poddy breaks anymore.
customer_reviews.author: R. A. Fox

customer_reviews.title: No rust or any issues
customer_reviews.text: Bought this almost 5 years ago for magazines in a bathroom. No rust or any other issues. Well made product. I'm now buying more.
customer_reviews.author: Beth Essex

customer_reviews.title: Slim, modern looking magazine holder
customer_reviews.text: I ordered 2 InterDesign Classico Wall Mount Newspaper and Magazine Holder Racks. My husband hung one in each bathroom, next to the toilet. It's been a few years, and they have both held up well. They house our bathroom reading material perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Dana M. Rabin

customer_reviews.title: Great magazine rack!
customer_reviews.text: This black magazine rack is great for our AirBnB guest bathroom. Easy installation and very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: JenInTn

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for small space on floor by toilet
customer_reviews.text: I chose the chrome basket because the accessories are chrome. It sits on the floor by the toilet and is perfect for a few magazines. There are finger holes to easily move the rack when needed. It's perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Paula

customer_reviews.title: Really cleaned up our space.
customer_reviews.text: We mounted this rack on the side of a small IKEA sink cabinet during a recent bathroom remodel. Wow, this is so much simpler and cleaner than a magazine rack on the floor! Simple and small design holds several magazines - plenty to read without being too much. Also, a smaller rack means papers don't get as bent as in the big ones. This really cleaned up our space. The unit was easy to mount and has been worry-free, and I'm grateful for it every time I use the bathroom.
customer_reviews.author: Dione

customer_reviews.title: Made well, sturdy and looks nice.
customer_reviews.text: I've had about a month, holds full of magazines. Easy install with included hardware. I was sick of magazines on my toilet top and counter top. Husband old school... :(
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Masterson

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this for months and it looks like new. It holds magazines and books and doesn't get scuffed.
customer_reviews.author: Tsutsuji

customer_reviews.title: Looks and functions as needed.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased as a gift from wish list. Person who received it is very happy. Rack is not very deep so it is great for narrow spaces, and it seems very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Care

customer_reviews.title: Hold up well
customer_reviews.text: I used these as bins for my 4 youngest children to put their school work in at my extremely small “mud room”. I’ve had them for several months now and they have worked out nicely. Easy to hang, great size for average size paper and folders, and stand up to kids grabbing on them all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Snailboat

customer_reviews.title: Perfect unit
customer_reviews.text: This wall hanger works great, exactly what I needed for the magazines in my Air BnB room
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Henderson

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: Does exactly what it was meant to do! No issues with installation, only needed a screwdriver and hammer!
customer_reviews.author: G Chase

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for tight space!
customer_reviews.text: Needed magazine holder for the "throne room." Perfect fit in small space.
customer_reviews.author: Marilyn Waters

customer_reviews.title: Simple magazine rack at favorable price. Good value.
customer_reviews.text: Nice basket. Not real fancy holds a good slug of magazines. The only thing I don't like is that you can't adjust the holes where you attach the screws. Could be used as a standup unit, but my tiny bathroom already had too much stuff on the floor. Seems very sturdy. Not overly shiny, which I like. More of a satin steel color. Note: thought should be used if mounting to a hollow door.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny Beans

customer_reviews.title: used as a hay feeder for rabbits
customer_reviews.text: used as a hay feeder for rabbits, and it works great! Bought 4 as hay feeders for our rabbits, and ending up getting a fifth one to use as a magazine holder!
customer_reviews.author: James Steven Watkins

customer_reviews.title: Nice!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my use of holding magazines in the bathroom.NicrN
customer_reviews.author: JB&TB

customer_reviews.title: LOVE this!
customer_reviews.text: Installed in in my bath. No more iPads or catalogs on the floor! Did it myself with hubby's drill. Perfect!
customer_reviews.author: tizpear

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: just what we needed, easy to contain the magazines etc. easy install.
customer_reviews.author: Posty

customer_reviews.title: No hardware
customer_reviews.text: Says it comes with hardware but mine didn't have any.
customer_reviews.author: Marcia R. Brocato

customer_reviews.title: Nice RACK!
customer_reviews.text: Super small Mag Rack. Was expecting this to be a little bigger for some reason, but the size is perfect for 5 or 6 Mags. Did not wall mount, but wouldn't be hard if that's what you wanted. This sits discreetly next to the throne.
customer_reviews.author: foolish69

customer_reviews.title: Very Small
customer_reviews.text: Seems well made and sturdy but I was surprised at how small this thing is. You could probably get three standard sized magazines in it, and it looks dinky on our bathroom wall. Yes - I read the dimensions and it was my mistake. The thing is what it is. Just a heads up for those who are looking to store more reading material.
customer_reviews.author: Luckydawg

customer_reviews.title: perfect photo book storage
customer_reviews.text: I create annual family photo books that are typically 8.5" x 8.5". I purchased two of these to store and display our collection on our wall, and they are perfect for the job. I fit four or five photo books in each basket, and they look really classy. They are also very sturdy and don't feel or look cheap at all. I will definitely be ordering more as my photo book collection grows :)
customer_reviews.author: river momma

customer_reviews.title: Nice product
customer_reviews.text: Use to hold magazines above toilet in bathrooms. Works well
customer_reviews.author: Donald H.

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed for my small guest bathroom
customer_reviews.text: Needed a small place to stash reading material in a small bathroom. Perfect. Magazines fit exactly and it is attached to the cabinet between the toilet and the cabinet. Exactly what I needed. If you have a big bathroom and want to stash big volumes, this might not be for you. However, I have several copies of Travel and Leisure (a pretty big magazine), and they fit perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Smug1

customer_reviews.title: Unlikely kitchen helper
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after seeing an example of a friend who mounted magazine racks inside of her kitchen cabinets to store cutting boards. I grabbed one of these for the same purpose, and on installing it immediately kicked myself for not buying 2. Headed back to order the second right now. Product as described, seemingly well made and sturdy. I am fully confident this thing is going to last a while and come with me to my next house.
customer_reviews.author: Kerry Smith

customer_reviews.title: Strong construction. Easy to install. Sleek Design.
customer_reviews.text: Looks as advertised. Strong construction. Easy to mount in stud or through drywall with supplied hardware. Holds several magazines and looks nice wherever you mount it.
customer_reviews.author: Stefan Olson

customer_reviews.title: Very nice.
customer_reviews.text: Love the small footprint. Made well. Classy looking for my newly remodeled bathroom.
customer_reviews.author: HappyGirl

customer_reviews.title: Very compact, love it!
customer_reviews.text: This is actually VERY compact (check out the measurements). The magazines stand up, so this is only as wide as a standard magazine. I mounted this with 3M Command hooks & strips so I wouldn't have to drill holes. I also used one inside my laundry room cupboard door. I store by dryer sheets & Swifter pads for easy access. I wanted to use it to store gift bags but it's not wide enough.
customer_reviews.author: LMSTop Contributor: Makeup

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: Great little magazine rack. It holds the standard sized magazines, and several of them. Quality metal, doesn't have a cheap look, just very unobtrusive and functional. Super easy to install. So grateful to have all those magazines off the tank top and floor! Will probably buy more for family and extra bathrooms.
customer_reviews.author: plazaliz

customer_reviews.title: High quality for the price.
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to use as a night stand after we upgraded our bed and ran out of room for a nightstand. I use it for my iPad, phone, headphone, cough drops, hair ties, and nose strips. It was easy to install and is high quality for the price. I would purchase this again if we needed one for another room.
customer_reviews.author: Alex J.

customer_reviews.title: The most efficiently and esthetically designed slim holder right next ...
customer_reviews.text: The most efficiently and esthetically designed slim holder right next to the toilet and at a reasonable price-point, no matter how small the area is. I have one in each of my home's bathrooms. I just leave them on the floors (there's no need to hang it up if you prefer not to). Many guests and friends positively commented on it. I've introduced it to many people to get it for their homes.
customer_reviews.author: J. Sa

customer_reviews.title: Smaller than expected
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't expecting this magazine holder to be so small. It looks bigger in the pictures. It's sturdy and unobtrusive, but if you have bigger magazines or several thick ones you want to hold, this won't do it. Any grocery circulars or adds that are wider likely won't fit either unless you fold them. I'm still giving this 4 stars because regardless of its size, it keeps my magazines in one place instead of being sprawled all over.
customer_reviews.author: JL

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for nighttime readers
customer_reviews.text: My daughters are avid bedtime readers and their nightstands are continually covered in books! I bought these to hang by their beds for bedtime reading. It helps control the clutter and lets them easily see what they have. They can only fill it so much (which makes them keep in check how many books they have out) and looks stylish! We love this new organizational find!
customer_reviews.author: My_5_Girls

customer_reviews.title: dont get
customer_reviews.text: doesnt hook onto the wall like it says it does
customer_reviews.author: Victoria Stadler

customer_reviews.title: just wright
customer_reviews.text: I needed a small magazine rack for my guest bathroom. It fits about 8 magazines
customer_reviews.author: ROSA MARIA GOMEZ

customer_reviews.title: Good design, good price
customer_reviews.text: Lots of "pro's" for this rack: well designed to keep mags corralled and orderly, very adequate size and dimensions while not being gigantic, very reasonable price, delivered quickly. Wish it was a little more substantially built, just a little bit "heftier". But overall I am very pleased with how it looks and how it fits the space I have available.
customer_reviews.author: hannah

customer_reviews.title: Cute
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my teeny little bathroom. Note that it will only hold standard sized magazines. Your "Juxtapose" won't fit. It's too wide.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse E.

customer_reviews.title: magazine rack
customer_reviews.text: using in bathroom ( library ) for magazines. Works great.
customer_reviews.author: jim finn

customer_reviews.title: Pretty cheap bad welds
customer_reviews.text: Product broke from tipping over by the side of the toilet.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size
customer_reviews.text: Large enough for the magazines we use. Deep enough to accommodate them, but not too deep to get in the way, as this was purchased for the bathroom.
customer_reviews.author: H. Pettit

customer_reviews.title: Can't beat the price, nice rack!
customer_reviews.text: I saw comparable magazine racks at twice the price in stores, and when I checked Amazon I found this. It is actually better made than similar items I've had before, and holds just enough to be really useful. Fastened to the wall nicely, and holds more than a dozen magazines. We have been using it for two years and it is still as shiny and sturdy as the day that we bought it. How can you go wrong (no pun intended)!
customer_reviews.author: retired guy

customer_reviews.title: Great little magazine rack.
customer_reviews.text: This rack is a great size for my small bathroom with limited wall space, yet big enough to hold a decent amount of magazines. Also, if you don't want to fuss the screws and anchors, another solution is to use two of those small tack/hook combos like these:Two little nails and just hang the rack on the hooks. Holds up to 10 lbs. Voila.
customer_reviews.author: E. White

customer_reviews.title: Looks Great!
customer_reviews.text: Looks great. Finish is as described and installation was easy. Currently holding roughly 8 magazines in the guest bathroom.
customer_reviews.author: Thom

customer_reviews.title: Just what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: Very well made and just what I wanted for my RV.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Ray

customer_reviews.title: I absolutely love this rack
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this rack! It is currently holding 6 of my husband's surfing magazines behind the bathroom door. It's sturdy even when screwed into plaster. I'm so pleased to have the magazines off the back of the toilet!!
customer_reviews.author: allison christie

customer_reviews.title: Great product for reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: It's a good product... Just wish the storage is slightly bigger
customer_reviews.author: AN

customer_reviews.title: Good rack for the bathroom
customer_reviews.text: I have this next to the toilet. It looks good and holds several magazines securely.
customer_reviews.author: sara

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and uncomplicated
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for a bathroom and sturdy. I did use different anchors right away, which I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Carol R. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Now if my hubby would just hang the darn thing, it would work so much better. Definitely holds several different magazines. Works while sitting on the floor. How do I know this? Because my hubby still has not hung it on the wall in the bathroom. Maybe one decade.....
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: Nice simple product.
customer_reviews.text: I put this in my bathroom for books and magazines so they didn't clutter up the counter. It looks great. It is the right size for a magazine, but not larger. The smaller size keeps things from sneaking down though. Easy to install.
customer_reviews.author: Nellie B

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Magazine Rack
customer_reviews.text: This is a great magazine holder. We used ours in the bathroom. Couldn't be happier with it.
customer_reviews.author: lassiegetgramps

customer_reviews.title: Hold iPad and magazines!
customer_reviews.text: Good for magazines of for an iPad. Easy to install and gets things up and out of the way.
customer_reviews.author: JP Howard

customer_reviews.title: Very functional and attractive
customer_reviews.text: Well make, good looking. Holds my magazines for the throne.
customer_reviews.author: BJB

customer_reviews.title: Reading solution
customer_reviews.text: There are times I like to have reading material in the bathroom -- and want to keep it there for reading during other sessions. This rack is working out just fine for that purpose. The only downside is that if you have only one magazine in the rack, it tends to crumple a bit.
customer_reviews.author: jwintle

customer_reviews.title: Great magazine racks
customer_reviews.text: I really like these magazine racks. I purchased two of them so as to be able to hang them in two of our bathrooms. My husband was always leaving reading materials on the floor which was messy. They are vert attractive and match the other hardware in our bathrooms. They are also a good size.
customer_reviews.author: Judith L. Imes

customer_reviews.title: Nice!
customer_reviews.text: This sturdy magazine rack was just what I needed to organize the magazine pile in the bathroom. It is easy to hang and holds about 6 magazines neatly.
customer_reviews.author: Kris

customer_reviews.title: My Thoughts
customer_reviews.text: I use this on the side of my bathroom cabinet to hold my hot flat iron and blow dryer, it works great for that!....and keeps it off my counter so I now have more room.
customer_reviews.author: My Thoughts

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: I love this magazine rack very sturdy and looks nice. I hung it under my toilet paper roll in the bathroom so all of our magazines aren't laying all over the floor.
customer_reviews.author: Sasha Penton

customer_reviews.title: Convenient
customer_reviews.text: I had a problem with any book or magazine getting wet when I laid them on the sink in the bathroom, so I put this magazine rack on the wall near the toilet to hold my reading material. It works very well and the finish on the wires it is made of gives it an attractive appearance, too.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Rodenz

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the bathroom One in silver and one in ...
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for the bathroom One in silver and one in chrome Great !
customer_reviews.author: Caryn and John Wheeler

customer_reviews.title: I loved the first one I got
customer_reviews.text: I loved the first one I got, and now we have one in every bathroom! I love the color options and prices, and the rack is super easy to put up. It's the perfect size and keeps all our reading material organized and off the floor.
customer_reviews.author: norberto g. pizarro

customer_reviews.title: Modern looking rack that makes my magazine storage pretty.
customer_reviews.text: Nice sleek design that is open so things don't get trapped in the bottom like some racks. Just a little narrow for the magazines that I am using it for but still works okay.
customer_reviews.author: Osagecoon

customer_reviews.title: Keeps me super organized!
customer_reviews.text: Bought four of these as I have 4 children in school. Mounted perfectly and easily on my walls. Use for papers and even wide enough for folders. Essential for proper organization around my house:)
customer_reviews.author: Meg

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, easy to hang.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to hang, holds plenty of full size magazines or plenty of mail/documents.
customer_reviews.author: booksandbutter

customer_reviews.title: This was perfect for my bathroom
customer_reviews.text: This was perfect for my bathroom! You can easily fit several magazines in it, and in my case, the National Enquirer (guilty!), which is wider than most magazines. It's very well made, easy install (2 screws), and looks great!
customer_reviews.author: IM4FROGS

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Love it -in my bathroom- just what I wanted .
customer_reviews.author: Ms.Miller

customer_reviews.title: Organize your bathroom library ...
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely perfect for our bathroom! No more magazines cluttering the vanity. You'd think a magazine rack for a bathroom would be easy to find at any Bed Bath & Beyond, WalMart or Target store, but NOooo. Easy to install, mags fit perfectly, hubby's happy & now I'm happy.
customer_reviews.author: V Bower

customer_reviews.title: Wall Mount Magazine Rack
customer_reviews.text: We wanted a small magazine rack to hang on our new tile wall in the bathroom. We don't have much space. We used suction cups (3 good ones) to hang it on the wall since we did not want to drill the tile to use screws. It is perfect to hold 4 or 5 magazines at a time. Also, looks nice.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon V

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: What can I say? It works great for what it is. We use it in the bathroom to hold magazines. I'm going to buy another for the upstairs bathroom.
customer_reviews.author: H. Collins

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, well designed magazine rack
customer_reviews.text: Gets the job done - very happy with this purchase. Based on the advice of another reviewer - we also mounted to the wall with mounting tape and it's held up perfectly (despite being loaded up quite full at times)
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product and great value. Very sturdy for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Bret S.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: They look small but hold a lot. Heavy duty construction
customer_reviews.author: M. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Just right
customer_reviews.text: We have a very small half bath. It has been decorated in Harley Davidson for my husband. This was the perfect little rack to hold his "HOG" magazines and looked very macho with the chrome. Simple to install. Keeps the magazines in order and off the floor.
customer_reviews.author: Gramma P.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love it for the bathroom to keep magazines handy for reading.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: We love it and it's right by the toilet paper on ...
customer_reviews.text: We love it and it's right by the toilet paper on the wall. Nobody sees it, but us, for it's in our back bathroom. Regular size magazines fit fine in ti, as well as my Reader's Digest. About 8 total will bit, depending on the thickness of the magazine. This just keeps the mags off of the back of the toilet. I use this for lotion, etc. :-) ....So GO BUY ONE!
customer_reviews.author: thomas a. brocksmith

product_meta.title: iDesign Classico Steel Wire Wall Mount Newspaper and Magazine Holder Rack for Bathroom Organization, Bronze
product_meta.description: Color:Bronze| Size:Set of 1Keep your reading material close with the iDesign Classico Wall Mount Magazine Holder. This wired design makes the most of your small space by providing extra storage for your magazines, newspapers, and books! Made of durable steel, this sturdy holder has a bronze finish that is cohesive with any decor. It easily hangs on open wall space with all the necessary mounting hardware included. You'll never be scrambling to clean up the magazines or newspapers off the floor again! Measuring 10.5" x 3.5" x 8.5", the iDesign Classico Wall Mount Magazine Holder is the solution to your organization needs! With iDesign by InterDesign, you can #LiveSimply every day.
feature_bullets: WALL MOUNT MAGAZINE HOLDER: Wired basket hangs easily to any open wall space to provide additional storage space. Store your magazines, newspapers, books, and other bathroom reading material in one convenient place to make organization a breeze!
COMPACT: Perfect for small spaces to keep clutter off the floor
EASY INSTALLATION: Wall mounting hardware included to ensure easy installation
DURABLE: Made of rust-resistant, durable steel with bronze finish for years of quality use
IDEAL SIZE: Hanging basket measures 10.5" x 3.5" x 8.5", making it the perfect storage basket for your small space
